org.jwave.model.player

Interface DynamicPlayer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DynamicEditorPlayerImpl, DynamicPlayerDecorator, DynamicPlayerImpl

    public interface DynamicPlayer
    This interface represents a dynamic player that can reproduce Song.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cue(int millis)
      Moves the reproduction cursor in a specific position of the audio file.
      int getLength() 
      java.util.Optional<Song> getLoaded() 
      int getPosition() 
      boolean hasStarted() 
      boolean isEmpty() 
      boolean isPaused() 
      boolean isPlaying() 
      void pause()
      Pauses audio reproduction.
      void play()
      Starts reproducing audio.
      void releasePlayerResources()
      Releases all the resources related to this player.
      void resetPlayer()
      resets this player.
      void setPlayer(Song song)
      Sets the player by loading a song.
      void setVolume(float amount)
      Modifies the current volume.
      void stop()
      Stops audio reproduction, rewinds the loaded audio file.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        void play()
   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts reproducing audio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no Song is loaded.

      • pause

        void pause()
    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Pauses audio reproduction.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no Song is loaded.

      • stop

        void stop()
   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Stops audio reproduction, rewinds the loaded audio file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no Song is loaded.

      • cue

        void cue(int millis)
  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Moves the reproduction cursor in a specific position of the audio file.
        Parameters:
        millis - the point of the file where the cursor has to be moved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no Song is loaded.

      • getLength

        int getLength()
       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns:
        the length of the loaded file in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no Song is loaded.

      • getPosition

        int getPosition()
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns:
        the current position in the loaded audio file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no Song is loaded.

      • getLoaded

        java.util.Optional<Song> getLoaded()
        Returns:
        the song loaded in the dynamic player.

      • isPlaying

        boolean isPlaying()
        Returns:
        whether the player is playing sound.

      • isPaused

        boolean isPaused()
        Returns:
        whether the player is paused.

      • hasStarted

        boolean hasStarted()
        Returns:
        whether the player has started.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        if the player has any song loaded.

      • setVolume

        void setVolume(float amount)
        Modifies the current volume.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of volume to be set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if amount < 0 || amount > 50.

      • setPlayer

        void setPlayer(Song song)
        Sets the player by loading a song.
        Parameters:
        song - the song to be loaded.

      • resetPlayer

        void resetPlayer()
        resets this player.

      • releasePlayerResources

        void releasePlayerResources()
        Releases all the resources related to this player.
